alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Logan County; Morgan County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:50AM MST until February 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A WINTER STORM ARRIVES THIS AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY IMPACTING NORTHERN COLORADO... .A system will bring heavy snowfall across the Front Range starting in the higher elevations later this afternoon. Snow begins in the foothills and northern I-25 corridor starting late tonight. The heaviest snowfall will occur in Park Range and the Larimer county foothills. This will likely lead to periods of poor visibility and difficult travel conditions especially in the Colorado high country. Also look for slow travel for the morning and afternoon commutes on Wednesday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 8 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes with blowing snow and poor visibility over the plains.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
